Introduction¶

Spystats is a software for performing model-based Geostatistics

Look our modules

Subclass for exponential Variogram

spystats.tools.PartitionDataSet(geodataset, namecolumnx, namecolumny, n_chunks=10, minimmum_number_of_points=10)[source]¶

Divides the given geodataset into n*n number of chunks Parameters :

geodataset (GeoDataset) with defined coordinates (geometric column) n_chunks : (int) desired number of chunks per dimension (resulting nxn chunks) minimmum_number_of_points : (int) the minimum number of points for accepting a chunk as valid.

Subclass for Spherical Variogram

class spystats.tools.Variogram(geopandas_dataset, response_variable_name, model=u'', using_distance_threshold=False)[source]¶

A class that defines Empirical Variogram objects.

calculateCovarianceMatrix()[source]¶

Returns an evaluation of the Covariance matrix, given the model stored as attribute.

calculateEmpirical(n_bins=50)[source]¶
Returns the empirical variogram given by the formula: $$ v_{lag_i} =

rac{sum_{i=1}^{N(lag_i)} (y_i - y_j)^2}{2} $$

Parameters:
n_bins : (Integer) number of bins (lag distances)

This only assigns the data to the corresponding attributes.

calculateEnvelope(num_iterations=99, n_bins=50)[source]¶

Calculates the Montecarlo variogram envelope.

fitTheoreticalVariogramModel(model, parameter_set)[source]¶

Fits a valid model (tools.model) to the empirical variogram object as base.

Parameters:
model : a Valid model (function) parameter_set : a tuple containing the init guesses for the parameters to be fitted from the model
Returns:
A function with the optimized parameters.
notes::
Deprecated. Use: fitVariogramModel
fitVariogramModel(model_instance, parameter_set=[])[source]¶

Fits a valid model (tools.models) to the empirical variogram object as base.

Parameters:
model_class : the class of a valid model. parameter_set : a tuple containing the init guesses for the parameters to be fitted from the model
Returns:
A function with the optimized parameters.
plot(with_envelope=False, percentage_trunked=10, refresh=True, n_bins=50, plot_filename=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plot the empirical semivariogram with optional confidence interval using MonteCarlo permutations at 0.025 and 0.975 quantiles. Returns a matplotlib object. Parameters :

with_envelope : (Boolean) if true it will calculate and plot the 0.025 and 0.975 quantiles of a montecarlo permutations of $Y$ using fixed locations. percentage_trunked = (float) Percentage of data removed in the plot. This is to ease the visualisation by cutting the last values
Extra parameters in the kwargs
  • num_iterations : (Integer) see CalculateEnvelope
  • n_bins : (Integer) see calculate_variogram
class spystats.tools.VariogramModel(sill=0, range_a=0, nugget=0)[source]¶

This class specifies several variogram models.

Returns an evaluation of the Covariance matrix, given a distance matrix. Parameters : numpy Matrix

Calculates the correlation function based on the given theoretical “intrinsic valid model” note:

Deprecated : Use corr_f

spystats.tools.calculateEmpiricalVariogram(distances, response_variable, n_bins=50, distance_threshold=False)[source]¶
Returns the empirical variogram given by the formula $$ v_{lag_i} =
rac{sum_{i=1}^{N(lag_i)} (y_i - y_j)^2}{2} $$
Parameters: n_bins : (Integer) number of bins (lag distances)
spystats.tools.createGrid(minx=0.0, maxx=1.0, miny=0.0, maxy=1.0, grid_sizex=50, grid_sizey=50)[source]¶

Create a Square Grid with custom coordinates an size. Parameters :

minx : (Float) where to start point 0 maxx :(FLoat) where to finish grid grid_size : (Int) number of points per side.
spystats.tools.exponentialVariogram(h, sill=0, range_a=0, nugget=0)[source]¶

The exponential variogram model

$$gamma (h)=(s-n)(1-exp(-h/(ra)))+n1_{{(0,infty )}}(h)$$

Parameters: h : (Float or Numpy Array) Distances to evaluate sill : Float range_a : Float nugget : Float
spystats.tools.gaussianVariogram(h, sill=0, range_a=0, nugget=0)[source]¶

The Gaussian Variogram, positive SEMI definite, and it’s not recommended to use.

$$gamma (h)=(s-n)left(1-exp left(-{

rac {h^{2}}{r^{2}a}} ight) ight)+n1_{{(0,infty )}}(h)$$

Parameters:
h : (Float or Numpy Array) Distances to evaluate sill : Float range_a : Float nugget : Float
spystats.tools.maternVariogram(h, sill=1, range_a=100, nugget=40, kappa=0.5)[source]¶

The Matern Variogram of order $kappa$.

$$ gamma(h) = nugget + (sill (1 - (

arc{1}{2^{kappa -1}} Gamma(kappa) ( rac{h}{r})^{kappa} K_kappa Big( rac{h}{r}Big)$$

Let:
a = $(2^{kappa -1} Gamma(kappa))^{-1}$

b = $

rac{h}{phi}$
K_v = Modified Bessel function of the second kind of real order v
spystats.tools.montecarloEnvelope(distances, response_variable, num_iterations=99, n_bins=50, distance_threshold=False)[source]¶

Generate Monte Carlo envelope by shuffling the response variable and keeping the distances the same. After GeoR. (“Model-Based Geostatistics; Diggle and Ribeiro, 2007”) Parameters :

distances (List) linearised format of a distance matrix response_variable (list) linearised format of a response distance matrix.
spystats.tools.simulateGaussianRandomField(variogram_model, grid, random_seed=False, return_matrix=True)[source]¶

Returns a Random simulation of the derived Multivariate Normal Distribution with $mu$ response variable and $Sigma$ = Resulting Covariate Matrix from model. Parameters :

variogram Model (Variogram) : an instance from variogram grid (Dataframe) : a geodata frame with coordinates. random_seed : (Integer) a random seed to reproduce results.

return_matrix : (Bool) if true it will return a square matrix.
note: For this case the grid must be SQUARE.

note: to create the variogram see: createSquareGrid

spystats.tools.simulatedGaussianFieldAsPcolorMesh(variogram_model, minx=0.0, maxx=1.0, miny=0.0, maxy=1.0, grid_sizex=50, grid_sizey=50, random_seed=False)[source]¶

A wrapper that creates a grid and performs a simulated Gaussian process It returns a triplet to plot directly using matplotlib.pcolor or pcolormesh.

note: It uses the functions: createGrid and simulateGaussianRandomField

spystats.tools.sphericalVariogram(h, sill=0, range_a=0, nugget=0)[source]¶

The spherical variogram

$$gamma (h)=(s-n)left(left({

rac {3h}{2r}}-{ rac {h^{3}}{2r^{3}}} ight)1_{{(0,r)}}(h)+1_{{[r,infty )}}(h) ight)+n1_{{(0,infty )}}(h))$$

Parameters: h : (Float or Numpy Array) Distances to evaluate sill : Float range_a : Float nugget : Float
spystats.tools.toGeoDataFrame(pandas_dataframe, xcoord_name, ycoord_name, srs=u'epsg:4326')[source]¶

Convert Pandas objcet to GeoDataFrame Inputs:

pandas_dataframe : the pandas object to spatialise xcoord_name : (String) the column name of the x coordinate. ycoord_name : (String) the column name of the y coordinate. srs : (String) the source referencing system in EPSG code.

e.g. epsg:4326 .
spystats.tools.whittleVariogram(h, sill=0, range_a=0, nugget=0, alpha=1)[source]¶
The Whittle Variogram, an alternative to the Gaussian Model. $$gamma (h)=(s-n)left(1-exp left(-{

rac {h^{lpha}}{r^{lpha}}} ight) ight)+n1_{{(0,infty )}}(h)$$

$$gamma (h)=sigma^2left(1-exp left(-{

rac {h^{lpha}}{r^{lpha}}} ight) ight)+n1_{{(0,infty )}}(h)$$

Parameters:
h : (Float or Numpy Array) Distances to evaluate sill : Float range_a : Float nugget : Float
